items.title: North Korea's Kim will meet with Xi and Putin at Chinese military parade

items.title: Putin and Kim to join Xi at Chinese military parade in show of defiance to the west
items.standfirst: The Victory Day parade in Beijing on 3 September will mark the formal surrender of Japan during the second world war. No western leaders will attendVladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un are among the world leaders who will attend a military parade with President Xi Jinping in Beijing next week, in a show of collective defiance amid western pressure.No western leaders will be among the 26 foreign heads of state and government attending the parade next week ‚Äì with the exception of Robert Fico, prime minister of Slovakia, a member of the European Union ‚Äì according to the Chinese foreign ministry. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin, Xi, and Kim set to unite at major military parade
items.standfirst: Kim Jong Un will join Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin at a major military parade in Beijing next week, North Korean and Chinese state media have announced.
items.content: Kim Jong Un will join Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin at a major military parade in Beijing next week, North Korean and Chinese state media have announced.

items.title: Kim Jong Un, Vladimir Putin to attend military parade in China next week
items.standfirst: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will make a rare international visit next week to attend a military parade in the Chinese capital, Chinese state media reported Thursday.
items.content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will make a rare international visit next week to attend a military parade in the Chinese capital, Chinese state media reported Thursday.

ai_summary: North Korea's Kim Jong Un will join Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping at a military parade in Beijing.
The parade will mark the formal surrender of Japan during World War II.
The event is seen as a show of defiance against Western pressure.
No Western leaders, except for Slovakia's prime minister, will attend the parade.
The parade will highlight the alignment between Beijing, Moscow, and Pyongyang.

clusters.title: 2 children killed, 17 people injured in shooting at Catholic school in Minneapolis
clusters.neutral_headline: Minneapolis School Shooting: Two Children Killed, 17 Injured

items.title: 2 children killed, 17 people injured in shooting at Catholic school in Minneapolis
items.standfirst: Two young children were killed and 17 others were injured in a shooting during a Catholic Mass packed with young students in south Minneapolis Wednesday morning. The shooter is also dead.
items.content: Two young children were killed and 17 others were injured in a shooting during a Catholic Mass packed with young students in south Minneapolis Wednesday morning. The shooter is also dead.

items.title: Minnneapolis wakes to aftermath of Catholic school shooting
items.standfirst: Officials say critically injured people expected to survive after attack that killed two children during massMinneapolis woke on Thursday to the aftermath of the mass shooting at a Catholic school in which two children were killed and 17 people injured, stunning the close-knit community and prompting the FBI to investigate the act as domestic terrorism and a hate crime targeting Catholics.A shooter at the Annunciation Catholic school in the south of the city killed two children, aged eight and 10, in church pews during morning mass. Fourteen other children, aged six to 15, were injured, two of them critically, though officials said they were expected to survive. The shooter killed themself. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials say critically injured people expected to survive after attack that killed two children during massMinneapolis woke on Thursday to the aftermath of the mass shooting at a Catholic school in which two children were killed and 17 people injured, stunning the close-knit community and prompting the FBI to investigate the act as domestic terrorism and a hate crime targeting Catholics.A shooter at the Annunciation Catholic school in the south of the city killed two children, aged eight and 10, in church pews during morning mass. Fourteen other children, aged six to 15, were injured, two of them critically, though officials said they were expected to survive. The shooter killed themself. Continue reading...

items.content: Two children are dead and more are injured after a shooting at a back-to-school Mass at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis.

items.title: Community grieves after two children shot dead in a Church in Minnesota
items.standfirst: A shooter opened fire through the windows of a church in Minneapolis on Wednesday, tragically killing two children. Fourteen other children and three elderly parishioners were also injured during the first week of classes at Annunciation Catholic School. The community came together that same day to mourn the victims. Peter O‚ÄôBrien reports.
items.content: A shooter opened fire through the windows of a church in Minneapolis on Wednesday, tragically killing two children. Fourteen other children and three elderly parishioners were also injured during the first week of classes at Annunciation Catholic School. The community came together that same day to mourn the victims. Peter O‚ÄôBrien reports.

Fourteen other children ages six to 15 were also injured, two of them in critical condition, but officials said on Wednesday afternoon they were all expected to survive. The shooter died by suicide. ai_summary: A shooting at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis killed two children.
Fourteen other children were injured, with two in critical condition.
The shooter is also dead, and the FBI is investigating the incident.
The shooting occurred during a back-to-school Mass at the church.
Local authorities found additional firearms at residences linked to the shooter.

clusters.title: US health agency‚Äôs Susan Monarez fired
clusters.neutral_headline: US CDC Director Fired Amid Vaccine Policy Disputes

items.title: US health agency‚Äôs Susan Monarez fired
items.standfirst: Health scientist and longtime civil servant Susan Monarez was fired from her short-lived role as head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the White House confirmed Wednesday. Monarez said she had refused to sign off on what she described as "unscientific, reckless directives" from Health Secretary and vaccine skeptic Robert F. Kennedy Jr. France2‚Äô International Affairs Editor Kethevane Gorjestani tells us more.
items.content: Health scientist and longtime civil servant Susan Monarez was fired from her short-lived role as head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the White House confirmed Wednesday. Monarez said she had refused to sign off on what she described as "unscientific, reckless directives" from Health Secretary and vaccine skeptic Robert F. Kennedy Jr. France2‚Äô International Affairs Editor Kethevane Gorjestani tells us more.

items.content: Susan Monarez fired while four officials resign amid tensions over vaccine policies and public health directives.

items.title: White House fires CDC director over vaccine disagreements
items.standfirst: A showdown at the CDC culminated in the White House formally firing its director, Susan Monarez, on Wednesday night. Monarez was ousted earlier in the day, after Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. asked her to step down amid disagreements over changing vaccine policies, The‚Ä¶
items.content: A showdown at the CDC culminated in the White House formally firing its director, Susan Monarez, on Wednesday night. Monarez was ousted earlier in the day, after Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. asked her to step down amid disagreements over changing vaccine policies, The‚Ä¶

items.title: Fired CDC director says RFK 'weaponising public health' as more leaders quit agency

items.content: The White House removes Dr Susan Monarez from her job running the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

items.title: CDC Director Susan Monarez refuses to step down, arguing only Trump can fire her
items.standfirst: Susan Monarez, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, has been removed from her job, a source told CBS News ‚Äî but her attorneys called her firing "legally deficient."
items.content: Susan Monarez, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, has been removed from her job, a source told CBS News ‚Äî but her attorneys called her firing "legally deficient."

items.title: White House fires US health agency chief after vaccine standoff
items.standfirst: Health scientist and longtime civil servant Susan Monarez was fired from her short-lived role as head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the White House confirmed Wednesday. Monarez said she had refused to sign off on what she described as "unscientific, reckless directives" from Health Secretary and vaccine skeptic Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
items.content: Health scientist and longtime civil servant Susan Monarez was fired from her short-lived role as head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the White House confirmed Wednesday. Monarez said she had refused to sign off on what she described as "unscientific, reckless directives" from Health Secretary and vaccine skeptic Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

items.title: CDC erupts in chaos after ousted chief Susan Monarez refuses to resign
items.standfirst: Lawyers for Monarez say she was ‚Äòtargeted‚Äô for ‚Äòprotecting the public‚Äô by not endorsing ‚Äòunscientific‚Äô ordersThe US‚Äôs top public health agency was plunged into chaos on Wednesday after the Trump administration moved to oust its leader Susan Monarez, sworn in less than a month ago, as her lawyers said she would not resign and that she was being ‚Äútargeted‚Äù for her pro-science stance.Monarez, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), was ousted on Wednesday evening, according to a statement from Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) that offered no explanation its decision. Continue reading...
items.content: Lawyers for Monarez say she was ‚Äòtargeted‚Äô for ‚Äòprotecting the public‚Äô by not endorsing ‚Äòunscientific‚Äô ordersThe US‚Äôs top public health agency was plunged into chaos on Wednesday after the Trump administration moved to oust its leader Susan Monarez, sworn in less than a month ago, as her lawyers said she would not resign and that she was being ‚Äútargeted‚Äù for her pro-science stance.Monarez, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), was ousted on Wednesday evening, according to a statement from Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) that offered no explanation its decision. Continue reading...

items.title: CDC chief ‚Äòtargeted‚Äô for refusing to ‚Äòrubber-stamp unscientific, reckless directives‚Äô, lawyers say ‚Äì as it happened
items.standfirst: This liveblog is now closed. Read the full story at the link below:CDC director Susan Monarez ousted after less than one month in the jobThis concludes our live coverage of the second Trump administration for the day, but we will be back at it on Thursday morning. Here are the latest developments:The leadership of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention was thrown into chaos after the health department announced the Senate-confirmed CDC director, Susan Monarez, was no longer in charge, but her lawyers said she refused to resign and had not been fired.First it was independent advisory committees and career experts. Then it was the dismissal of seasoned scientists. Now, Robert F Kennedy Jr and HHS have set their sights on ‚Äúweaponizing public health for political gain‚Äù and ‚Äúputting millions of American lives at risk‚Äù, lawyers for Monarez said in a statement. ‚ÄúWhen CDC Director Susan Monarez refused to rubber-stamp unscientific, reckless directives and fire dedicated health experts, she chose protecting the public over serving a political agenda. For that, she has been targeted. Dr. Monarez has neither resigned nor received notification from the White House that she has been fired, and as a person of integrity and devoted to science, she will not resign.‚ÄùAt least three CDC senior officials resigned after Monarez was ousted. One squarely blamed Robert F Kennedy Jr‚Äôs leadership.‚ÄúI am not able to serve in this role any longer because of the ongoing weaponization of public health,‚Äù Dr Demetre Daskalakis, who resigned as director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases told colleagues.Public health experts are sounding the alarm about the chaos at the CDC, as at least three senior leaders resigned following the ouster of the apparent ouster of the CDC director.As a Senate-confirmed official, only the president has the authority to fire her, and, for once, Donald Trump has been strangely silent as this drams unfolded. But the White House press office issued a statement saying that Monarez had been removed, not by Trump but by ‚Äúthe White House‚Äù. Continue reading...
items.content: This liveblog is now closed. Read the full story at the link below:CDC director Susan Monarez ousted after less than one month in the jobThis concludes our live coverage of the second Trump administration for the day, but we will be back at it on Thursday morning. Here are the latest developments:The leadership of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention was thrown into chaos after the health department announced the Senate-confirmed CDC director, Susan Monarez, was no longer in charge, but her lawyers said she refused to resign and had not been fired.First it was independent advisory committees and career experts. Then it was the dismissal of seasoned scientists. Now, Robert F Kennedy Jr and HHS have set their sights on ‚Äúweaponizing public health for political gain‚Äù and ‚Äúputting millions of American lives at risk‚Äù, lawyers for Monarez said in a statement. ‚ÄúWhen CDC Director Susan Monarez refused to rubber-stamp unscientific, reckless directives and fire dedicated health experts, she chose protecting the public over serving a political agenda. For that, she has been targeted. Dr. Monarez has neither resigned nor received notification from the White House that she has been fired, and as a person of integrity and devoted to science, she will not resign.‚ÄùAt least three CDC senior officials resigned after Monarez was ousted. One squarely blamed Robert F Kennedy Jr‚Äôs leadership.‚ÄúI am not able to serve in this role any longer because of the ongoing weaponization of public health,‚Äù Dr Demetre Daskalakis, who resigned as director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases told colleagues.Public health experts are sounding the alarm about the chaos at the CDC, as at least three senior leaders resigned following the ouster of the apparent ouster of the CDC director.As a Senate-confirmed official, only the president has the authority to fire her, and, for once, Donald Trump has been strangely silent as this drams unfolded. But the White House press office issued a statement saying that Monarez had been removed, not by Trump but by ‚Äúthe White House‚Äù. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Susan Monarez was fired as CDC director after disagreements over vaccine policies.
Monarez refused to sign off on directives from Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
Four other top officials resigned from the CDC around the same time.
Monarez's attorneys called her firing "legally deficient."
The White House confirmed Monarez's removal from her position.

clusters.title: Russia claims it is still interested in peace talks but will continue with ‚Äòmilitary operation‚Äô after deadly strikes on Kyiv - Europe live

items.title: Russia claims it is still interested in peace talks but will continue with ‚Äòmilitary operation‚Äô after deadly strikes on Kyiv - Europe live
items.standfirst: Overnight raid kills at least 14 and hits British Council and EU delegation offices as European leaders condemn ‚Äòdeliberate‚Äô targeting of civilians and institutionsUkrainian prime minister Yulia Svyrydenko has now responded to the overnight Russian attacks on Kyiv, criticising Moscow for ‚Äúhorrific and deliberate killing of civilians.‚Äù‚ÄúThe Russians are not choosing to end the war, only constant expansion of atrocities,‚Äù she said.‚ÄúOvernight in Kyiv, dozens of buildings were hit: residential houses, office centers, civilian enterprises. Among them also the building where the European Union Delegation to Ukraine is located. Russians now believe that they have paralyzed Ukraine‚Äôs allies with feigned plans for ‚Äònegotiations‚Äô and endless delays that only serve as methods to buy time with the true goal only of preventing sanctions.‚ÄúMy thoughts are with all those affected by the senseless Russian strikes on Kyiv which have damaged the British Council building. Putin is killing children and civilians, and sabotaging hopes of peace. Continue reading...

Among them also the building where the European Union Delegation to Ukraine is located. Russians now believe that they have paralyzed Ukraine‚Äôs allies with feigned plans for ‚Äònegotiations‚Äô and endless delays that only serve as methods to buy time with the true goal only of preventing sanctions.‚ÄúMy thoughts are with all those affected by the senseless Russian strikes on Kyiv which have damaged the British Council building. Putin is killing children and civilians, and sabotaging hopes of peace. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia strikes the heart of Ukraine: At least 12 killed in mass drone and missile attack on Kyiv
items.standfirst: A ‚Äúmassive‚Äù Russian assault on Kyiv early Thursday resulted in the deaths of at least 12 people and left dozens more injured, according to Ukrainian officials. Powerful explosions rocked the Ukrainian capital during the night, illuminating the sky and sending a column of smoke into the air as emergency services raced to the affected areas. France24 Correspondent Emmanuelle Chaze reports the latest from Kyiv, Ukraine.

ai_summary: Russian missile and drone attacks on Kyiv killed at least 14 people.

clusters.title: Denmark summons US envoy over suspected influence operations in Greenland

items.title: Denmark summons US envoy over suspected influence operations in Greenland
items.standfirst: Denmark has summoned the US charg√© d‚Äôaffaires for talks following intelligence reports that American citizens have been involved in covert influence operations in Greenland, the Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs said. The move came after Denmark‚Äôs national broadcaster reported that the government suspects at least three individuals linked to Donald Trump‚Äôs administration of attempting to promote Greenland‚Äôs secession from Denmark in favour of joining the United States. Emerald Maxwell reports.

items.content: Residents in Washington's Columbia Heights neighbourhood say there has been a surge in immigration arrests since President Trump's crime crackdown started.

ai_summary: Violent crime is down in D.C. since National Guard deployment.
The National Guard was deployed by President Trump.
The comparison is to the same time last year.
There has been a surge in immigration arrests.
The arrests are in the Columbia Heights neighborhood.

items.title: SpaceX Starship Finally Pulls Off a Successful Test Flight

items.title: Watch: SpaceX Starship completes successful test flight
items.standfirst: Elon Musk's giant rocket, earmarked for use in a 2027 mission to the Moon, has had multiple catastrophic failures in previous launches.
items.content: Elon Musk's giant rocket, earmarked for use in a 2027 mission to the Moon, has had multiple catastrophic failures in previous launches.

ai_summary: SpaceX Starship completed a successful test flight.
The test flight was the tenth attempt.
Previous launches had multiple failures.
The rocket is earmarked for a 2027 mission to the Moon.
The flight was successful after multiple postponements.
